in and the smell in my travelling companions room , i can only give this an average score and will find alternative lodging the next time i visit exeter , nh .we would stay here again .hampton inns can vary from location to location but this was one great hampton . </DOC> the hotel is four stories high and looks pretty new .it is just off route 101and there are many restaurants nearby .someone came up within minutes and changed the bulb .the breakfast was excellent and included everything . </DOC> running the fan helped , but did n't make it completely quiet .the little town of exeter is about a 1/2 mile walk .not especially charming walk along busy road , but there is a sidewalk the whole way .dunkin ' donuts , rite aid and walgreens nearby .will certainly stay again . </DOC> i highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area .i was by myself and was provided with everything i needed from the staff .this is a great alternative to the overpriced and overrated exeter inn .the location is terrific-there is a dunkin donuts next door , two pharmacies within a one minute walk , while downtown exeter is only a three minute drive away . </DOC> there was also a large dressing area off the bedroom .stayed for a week and the location was great .i liked that it was close to the lobster boat and there was a fridgeeach other morning i could n't really get into the breakfast area for the rest of the week .there are n't really that many hotels in the area </DOC> we ate the hotel 's complimentary breakfast and also used their no - charge shuttle .the area where breakfast is served is done up to also serve as a gathering area .whoever decorated here did a great job .and , given that people eat in this area , one might expect to find some evidence of that , but , not here : no coffee or grease stains on the cloth chairs .there was a small wet - bar , a living area , and a separate sleeping area .
